tutorial.title: Z-index
tutorial.descriptionContent: Learn how to move elements in front or behind other elements.

lessons.title: Intro
lessons.interactiveContent: Let's learn how to control overlapping elements.

lessons.title: Image
lessons.interactiveContent:
We'll start off with an image with a heading below it. Set the image's width to 300px.

Make sure to pick width followed by : and then 300px, ;.

lessons.title: Absolute
lessons.interactiveContent:
Setting an image to position: absolute removes it from the normal flow. That's why the image overlaps over the heading.

Make sure to pick position followed by : and then absolute, ;.

lessons.title: Z-index
lessons.interactiveContent:
We can control how images overlap with a property called z-index. Set z-index to 0, its default value.

Make sure to pick z-index followed by : and then 0, ;.

lessons.title: Baseline
lessons.interactiveContent:
Because all elements have their z-index set to 0 by default, the browser puts the image in front because it's the first element in the HTML.

Make sure to pick 0.

lessons.title: Negative value
lessons.interactiveContent:
To place an element behind another, we set z-index to a lower number. In this case, code -1.

Make sure to pick -1.

lessons.title: Any numbers
lessons.interactiveContent:
Any whole number works. Place the logo class image in front of the other image by setting the z-index to 1.

Make sure to type 1.

lessons.title: Higher numbers
lessons.interactiveContent:
Elements with a higher z-index number are always in front. Set the third image's z-index to 2 to make it overlap the first two images.

Make sure to type 2.

lessons.title: Question: Baseline
lessons.interactiveContent:
What's the default z-index value for elements?

01

Make sure to pick 0.

lessons.title: Question: Negative value
lessons.interactiveContent:
What does this code display?

An image behind a headingA heading behind an image

An image behind a heading.

lessons.title: Question: Any numbers
lessons.interactiveContent:
What does this code display?

The image of class logo in front of another imageThe image of class logo behind another image

The image of class logo in front of another image.

lessons.title: Question: Higher numbers
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which elements are in front of other elements?

The elements with a higher z-index numberThe elements with a lower z-index number

The elements with a higher z-index number.

lessons.title: Example: Z-index
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code the baseline value of z-index: 0;.

Make sure to pick z-index followed by : and then 0, ;.

lessons.title: Example: Negative Values
lessons.interactiveContent:
Place the image behind the heading by setting z-index to -1.

Make sure to type -1.

lessons.title: Example: Any numbers
lessons.interactiveContent:
Place the image of class nacho on top of any other images.

Make sure to pick 2, followed by 1.

lessons.title: Example: Higher numbers
lessons.interactiveContent:
Place the element of class nacho in the middle of the other two images.

Make sure to type 1.
